document_data.caption: Confronted by Rathgar, the king lies wounded on this throne with his daughter attending him.
document_data.name: King of Doegan
document_data.mainbody: During the time of the [[Bloodforge Wars]] ([[648 DR|648]]–[[657 DR]]), the '''king''' of the realm of [[Doegan]] in the [[Utter East]] saw his kingdom fall.<ref group="note">This king is, of course, unnamed.
document_data.History:
Doegan was overrun by invaders led by [[Rathgar the Raider]], who plundered the realm and laid siege to the [[Doegan Capital|capital]]. Finally, Rathgar came for the crown itself, and confronted the king and [[princess of Doegan|princess]] in their own throne room, wounding the ruler. However, with his dying breath, the defiant king cursed him, declaring "For so long as you rule, a curse upon you. The dead will arise, to ensure your demise."

Escaping the invaders, the princess of Doegan looked for a way to make her father's prophecy come true. She went to [[Old Stone Keep]] and there met [[Aelric the Avenger|Aelric]], and enlisted his aid. They then led armies of [[undead]] against Rathgar's forces.
document_data.Description: The king of Doegan appeared to be a mage. He dressed in black, with a purple robe and high collar. He had a goatee and black hair [[fiertallin|streaked with white]]. When he cursed Rathgar, the symbol over his throne—a fiendish long-horned skull and [[ankh]]—glowed green.
